payload.name: little-s-law
payload.title: Little’s law: (L = \lambda W) makes autoscaling/admission math explicit
payload.formal: average number in system (L) equals arrival rate (\lambda) times average time in system (W).
payload.apm2_mapping: treat “active work items,” “in-flight tool calls,” and “queued pulses” as (L). If you can measure (\lambda) (arrivals) and want bounded (W) (latency), then you must enforce admission control (53) or increase capacity. “Heuristic autoscaling” without Little’s law is basically superstition.
